edu.rit.LightBikesServer

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.LightBikesServer.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Player.java

    Assignment: Final Project

    Class: Rochester Institute of Technology, ISTE-121.01, 2155

    Professor: Michael Floeser

    Runnable class for each client connected to the GameServer. Player includes a threaded Listener inner class to process data sent by its assigned client.

    Version:
    2016.04.11.v1
    Author:
    Felice Aprile, Justin W. Flory, Malcolm Jones, Timothy Endersby

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.net.Socket s,
              int playerID,
              GameServer gameServer,
              javax.swing.JTextArea playerOutput)
        Create a new subserver for a connected player.
        Parameters:
        s - The socket the player is connected to.
        playerID - The ID set of this player, as set by the GameServer.
        gameServer - The reference to the GameServer instance handling all the player connections.
        playerOutput - The GameServer GUI component where interactions with this player are recorded.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Initializes I/O for the client connection and initial communication such as sending over the player's id assigned by the GameServer.

        Player is threaded, and therefore it is recommended to call the start method of Thread created with this Player object instead of calling the run method directly.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • push

        public void push(java.lang.String line)
        Pushes out a message to the individual client.
        Parameters:
        line - The message to be sent

      • push

        public void push(java.lang.String command,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Make and pushes out a command-value string to this client.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to use when making the command-value string.
        value - The value to use when making the command-value string.

      • getPlayerID

        public int getPlayerID()
        Gets the playerID. Player IDs are assigned by the GameServer on creation of the player object.
        Returns:
        The player id of this Player.
